CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 3, reads: "'Carver Week' Proclaimed - Mayor David Lawrence issued a proclamation Monday setting aside the week of Jan. 2 to 9 as "George Washington Carver Week." Mayor Lawrence was busy with duties elsewhere at the time the committee in charge of the Allegheny County Carver Week observance called to pick up the proclamation he had signed so Councilman Patrick T. Fagan filled in for him.  Seated, left to right, are Patrick T. Fagan, City Councilman; Mrs. Irene Hogan, Mrs. Alma Illery, Mrs. Mary K. Marshall, chairman of the Carver Day Luncheon, and Mrs. Mary Clark, vice president of the national Achievement Clubs, Inc.  Standing are Raymond Talbert, chairman of the memorial service; Rd. Allen Figurel, treasurer; Boyd L. Wilson, co-chairman of the Carver celebration, and Dr. C.H.W. Pullen, general chairman. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, seated from left: Patrick T. Fagan, Irene Hogan, Alma Illery, Mary K. Marshall, Mary Clark; standing: Raymond Talbert, Dr. Allen Figurel, Boyd L. Wilson, and Dr. C. H. W. Pullen, gathered in Office of the Mayor for George Washington Carver Week proclamation, City County Building, Downtown
